intro: Calycadenia multiglandulosa var. cephalotes, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that are adapted to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Its small, clustered inflorescences are surrounded by bracts, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
